decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Fleecemane Lion, backed up by powerful spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while also gaining incremental advantages through lifegain and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support a consistent and smooth curve of plays, allowing the deck to effectively disrupt the opponent's game plan and close out the game before they can establish their own strategy.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence through efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix, supported by removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Abzan Charm. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Elspeth, Sun's Champion to provide additional value and aggression. Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Wingmate Roc and Ajani, Mentor of Heroes offer additional threats and card advantage. The manabase is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and help cast the deck's powerful spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Rakshasa Deathdealer, and Heir of the Wilds, supported by powerful spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall. It aims to control the board with removal (Bile Blight, Sorin) and disrupt the opponent's strategy with discard (Thoughtseize). The deck's curve is topped off with strong finishers like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost, creating a fast-paced and proactive playstyle. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on utilizing green ramp cards to quickly gather resources and cast big creatures like Polukranos, Hornet Queen, and Doomwake Giant. Control elements are added with cards like Whip of Erebos and Eidolon of Blossoms to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control the battlefield with enchantments and removal spells. The mana base is designed to support the ramp strategy with lands that produce multiple green mana and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for the spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with green creatures and lands to cast powerful creatures and enchantments, such as Hornet Queen, Arbor Colossus, and See the Unwritten. The combination of Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Courser of Kruphix allows for consistent mana generation, while Doomwake Giant and Polukranos provide board control. Eidolon of Blossoms and Pharika, God of Affliction offer card advantage and graveyard interaction. The strategy is to overwhelm opponents with big threats while maintaining control of the board through efficient ramp and creature interaction.

The main concept of this deck is to use mana ramp cards like Elvish Mystic, Sylvan Caryatid, and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to quickly generate a large amount of mana. This allows you to play powerful, high-cost green creatures like Polukranos, World Eater and Genesis Hydra early in the game. Along with control cards like Doomwake Giant and Courser of Kruphix, this deck aims to dominate the board and overwhelm your opponent with big creatures and powerful abilities.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using mana-producing creatures and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to cast powerful green creatures. The goal is to control the board with Doomwake Giant's ability to give -1/-1 to all opposing creatures, while using Genesis Hydra and Chord of Calling to search for essential creatures like Hornet Queen and Arbor Colossus. Nylea's ability to give trample to creatures and the card draw from Eidolon of Blossoms provide additional advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures and maintain board control through constant threats.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up your mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, and generate an overwhelming advantage over your opponent using powerful green creatures like Polukranos, World Eater and Arbor Colossus. Utilizing cards like Xenagos, the Reveler and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker, you can quickly close out games with big threats like Stormbreath Dragon. The deck also includes control elements like Crater's Claws and Courser of Kruphix to help maintain board control and provide additional utility.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana early in the game with cards like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid, then using that mana to play big threats like Polukranos, World Eater and Arbor Colossus. The deck also includes cards like Courser of Kruphix and Genesis Hydra to help with card advantage and filter through the deck. Once enough mana is generated, the deck can finish off opponents with powerful spells like Crater's Claws or overwhelm them with a swarm of creatures like Hornet Queen.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana and generating card advantage. The deck achieves this by using green ramp cards such as Elvish Mystic, Sylvan Caryatid, and Voyaging Satyr to accelerate mana production. It also includes cards like Courser of Kruphix to gain extra land drops and card selection. The deck then aims to play big threats like Genesis Hydra, Polukranos, Arbor Colossus, and Stormbreath Dragon to control the board. The deck also has a small burn package with Crater's Claws to deal with problematic creatures or as a finisher.

This deck aims to control the game by ramping up mana with green cards and using powerful creatures and spells to dominate the opponent. By playing mana accelerators like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid, the deck can quickly bring out big threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Genesis Hydra. The inclusion of removal spells like Lightning Strike and Crater's Claws help maintain board control while cards like Courser of Kruphix provide card advantage. Overall, the strategy revolves around accelerating mana production to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures and versatile spells.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful and efficient creatures and spells to quickly pressure them and win the game before they have a chance to recover. By utilizing cards like Crater's Claws, Stoke the Flames, Stormbreath Dragon, and Polukranos, World Eater, the deck aims to deal large amounts of damage quickly while also maintaining a solid board presence with cards like Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid. Xenagos, the Reveler and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker provide additional threats and support for the aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and utilizing burn spells to quickly lower the opponent's life total. Seeker of the Way, Mantis Rider, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Ashcloud Phoenix provide a fast clock while spells like Magma Spray, Lightning Strike, Jeskai Charm, and Stoke the Flames can finish off the opponent or deal with threats. Dig Through Time offers card advantage and helps find key pieces of the deck, while Temple lands help with fixing mana. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent by playing low-cost aggressive creatures and casting burn spells to finish them off. By efficiently using cheap spells to pump up creatures and deal direct damage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the very beginning of the game, forcing them to react immediately or risk being overtaken by the powerful Aggro strategies. The deck relies on speed, efficiency, and relentless aggression to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, leveraging the mana acceleration provided by Rattleclaw Mystic and Elvish Mystic to quickly deploy threats like Savage Knuckleblade and Polukranos, World Eater. The deck also includes burn spells like Crater's Claws and Lightning Strike for removal and reach, while cards like Boon Satyr and Ashcloud Phoenix provide additional flexibility and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and burn spells to maintain aggressive pressure on the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and quickly developing a strong board presence, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and ultimately win the game through a combination of direct damage and combat damage. The key strategy is to leverage the flexibility of the cards in the deck to adapt to different situations and maintain a consistent offensive strategy throughout the game.

The main objective of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while also having access to powerful removal spells and pump effects. By utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures like Savage Knuckleblade, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Polukranos, World Eater, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like Crater's Claws and Temur Charm provide versatile removal options, while cards like Boon Satyr and Heir of the Wilds offer additional combat tricks to help maintain board control and secure victory.
